ai.summary: Green Link Walk (Section 4) is a challenging 17.3 km hike in the UK. This hard-rated route demands good fitness, navigation, and preparation. Expect long distances, rolling hills, and sections that test footing.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail blends tarmac or crushed gravel paths, grassy fields, muddy stretches, and rocky or exposed sections. Expect elevation changes typical of a long UK countryside walk; footing can be uneven, with roots and wet patches. In wetter conditions, the route can be slippery and shallow water crossings may require caution.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly; be prepared for wind, rain, and cold. The distance and elevation demand good physical condition and navigation ability. Carry a map and compass or GPS, wear sturdy footwear with good traction, and have extra layers. Start early to ensure daylight, and carry headlamp, a whistle, a first aid kit, sufficient water and food. Be cautious on exposed sections and potential mud or puddles; let someone know your plans.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good traction
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline maps and portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April-October) are generally best; winter hikes require extra caution due to weather, shorter daylight, and potential ice or snow.

seo.title: Green Link Walk (Section 4) – 17.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan your challenge on the Green Link Walk Section 4: a 17.3 km hard route in the UK with varied terrain, demanding fitness and good gear. Safety tips and gear list included.
